column4: Back up, boot off a livecd, mount your old root and your new /usr, rsync -rlptoP /mnt/oldroot/usr/ /mnt/newusr/ , empty /mnt/oldroot/usr/ , change the fstab and reboot.  Hopefully.
what if i just copied everything from old to new, and mounted the new partition to /usr,  will there be problem rather than the rsnyc command?
rsync will ensure that permissions etc are preserved.
